text: [Applause]
this violent day of street clashes has
finally come to an end the protesters
were here in their thousands tens of
thousands at the height and have now
finally been pushed by right police sort
of block-by-block towards the train
station and they've left and behind me
I'm sure you can see that the right
place
to it now sitting down resting after
having a full day of battles with
hardline protesters throwing bricks and
other projectiles at them they've
responded by firing rubber bullets tear
gas pepper spray and it just shows yet
again that these protests are escalating
in terms of the level of violence you
know a few weeks ago we saw the odd
projectile maybe being thrown back at
the police but today there were a lot
you know protesters came here geared up
for battle really some had their
homemade shields their own gas masks
their own helmets they knew there was
going to be a big fight and there's no
sign of an end to this we're now in the
second month of this political crisis
the protesters have expanded what
they're calling for they initially we're
demanding that this bill be withdrawn
this unpopular bill allowing for people
to be extradited to mainland Chinese
courts controlled by the Communist Party
that bill is now effectively political
debt lyrically dead that is mass street
rallies featuring hundreds of thousands
of people killed it and yet emboldened
now bolstered by that victory if you
like they've decided to accelerate and
they're going in harder attacking the
authorities they believe the peaceful
path doesn't work now and for many they
think this is it this is the fight for
Hong Kong that had to come and they're
hoping somehow that this will lead to
genuine democratic elections here but
there's no sign that the government in
Hong Kong and especially in Beijing will
be prepared to grant them that in fact
potentially it could go the other way
imagine the Politburo Standing Committee
in Beijing watching this rebellious City
where tens of thousands of people are
prepared to attend what is essentially
an illegal gathering
that the nuclear option for them would
be to send out the People's Liberation
Army who are garrisoned in the city to
take back control of the streets but
really that would be the end of Hong
Kong as we know it
